meanings.definition: The inner sense of what is right or wrong in one's conduct.
meanings.sent1: Her consciences told her not to cheat on the test.
meanings.sent2: People rely on their consciences to make ethical decisions.
meanings.sent3: Even his consciences couldn't convince him to steal.
meanings.sent4: The consciences of society are reflected in its laws.
meanings.sent5: The weight of his consciences kept him up at night.

meanings.definition: The faculty or principle of the mind by which one distinguishes between right and wrong.
meanings.sent1: Our consciences guide us in making moral choices.
meanings.sent2: Teachers often emphasize the importance of listening to our consciences.
meanings.sent3: The cat's consciences seemed to be judging us as we ate pizza.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of good and evil, our consciences are our strongest weapon.
meanings.sent5: The consciences of the characters in the story were tested by difficult decisions.
